result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devyn J. King

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Devyn J. King in court.  Attorney Jack Steven Lindberg in court for Devyn J. King.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants request to amend conditions of cash bond of $500 with conditions of Possess no firearms or weapons. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact directly or indirectly with victim SK, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  May have contact with victim regarding son, but not in person. No in person contact.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Possess no firearms or weapons. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact directly or indirectly with victim SK, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  May have contact with victim regarding son, but not in person. No in person contact.
Bail/bond hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 4, 2023 at 11:15 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

3:01 PM Defendant Devyn J. King appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jack Steven Lindberg appeared by video for Devyn J. King.  Attorney Derek W Brown appeared by video for Devyn J. King.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim S.K. appeared by video. State objects to a bond modification. Victim S.K. advises contact with Defendant is O.K. Court modifies bond: Defendant may have contact with child except in person contact; No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.K., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere, except for allowing contact between Defendant and J.K. All other previous bond conditions remain the same.

Possess no firearms or weapons. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact directly or indirectly with victim SK, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with SK's son.  May have contact with victim and son regarding son, but not in person.  No in person contact.
Defendant's Motion to File Further Motions After Receipt of Discovery

records.addlTxt:
Order on motion to seal or redact court record
The original document was titled: Attachment to affidavit
The original history event date is: 09-08-2022

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:08 AM Defendant Devyn J. King appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Derek W Brown appeared by video for Devyn J. King.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Parties argue to modify bond condition. Court makes no ruling on bond motion today. Court continues matter for victim S.K. to be notified of bond motion. Attorney Brown objects to continuance. Attorney Johnson states this is not a victim case, but his office will notify victim S.K. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
